newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Labour confirms "exchange of papers" with NZ First.
newsitem.headline: Labour confirms "exchange of papers" with NZ First.

text.p: The Labour and New Zealand First parties exchanged papers covering policy issues and allocation of ministerial portfolios, and were set to hold fresh coalition talks later on Wednesday, a Labour spokesman said.
"There has been an exchange of papers today. It's likely there's going to be a meeting later on today, but a time for that has not been scheduled yet," the spokesman said.
He said he was loath to describe the documents as a definitive coalition proposal. But, asked if they covered both policy areas and portfolios, he said: "They cover everything."
NZ First is also in coalition talks with the caretaker National Party government.
Caretaker Prime Minister Jim Bolger declined comment on the state of coalition negotiations as he entered a meeting of National's parliamentary caucus.

National and Labour have both been negotiating to form a government with NZ First since an inconclusive general election on October 12. Parliament is due to convene for the first time by December 13. -- Wellington newsroom 64 4 473-4746
